team_constraints.statement: The system must be buildable and operable by a team of 6 engineers or fewer.
team_constraints.rationale: Architectures that require constant specialization or 24/7 heroics will not be sustainable.

cost_discipline.statement: Baseline infrastructure costs must remain predictable and defensible to non-technical stakeholders.
cost_discipline.rationale: Unexpected cost growth erodes trust and constrains future investment.
violation_examples: costs tied directly to user behavior without controls
lack of cost visibility at service boundaries

operational_observability.statement: The system must be diagnosable without requiring ad-hoc instrumentation in production.
operational_observability.rationale: Systems that cannot explain their own behavior increase mean time to recovery.
violation_examples: metrics that do not align with user-facing symptoms

reversibility.statement: Major architectural decisions must be reversible without a full rewrite.
reversibility.rationale: Irreversible decisions increase long-term risk and lock the organization into early assumptions.
violation_examples: hard-coded assumptions about scale or geography
